decks.notes: This UWx Control deck focuses on disrupting opponent's strategies with counterspells and removal spells, while also utilizing card advantage and efficient card draw to control the game. Key cards like Back to Basics, Force of Will, and Swords to Plowshares help to maintain board control, while cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Ponder provide card selection and filtering. The inclusion of versatile cards like Dress Down and Prismatic Ending allow for flexibility in dealing with various threats. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue opponents and win through incremental advantages and resource management.

This Doomsday combo deck focuses on quickly assembling the necessary cards to win the game in a single turn. It utilizes cards like Brainstorm, Dark Ritual, and Doomsday to set up a winning pile of cards, often including Thassa's Oracle to win the game on the spot. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to efficiently and effectively execute the Doomsday combo while controlling the game through counter magic and discard spells.

The main focus of this deck is to leverage Cloudpost and ramp up mana quickly to play powerful Eldrazi creatures and artifacts. With tools like Crop Rotation, Grim Monolith, and Karn, the Great Creator, the deck aims to assemble a powerful board state with high mana production and powerful threats. The inclusion of cards like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Ugin provides additional win conditions and control options. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with big plays and efficiently use its mana resources to dominate the game.

The main concept of the deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Cloudposts and other lands, while using powerful combo pieces like Karn, the Great Creator and Planar Nexus to control the game and disrupt the opponent. The deck also utilizes Eldrazi Confluence and Kozilek's Command for additional control and removal, while using powerful spells like Force of Will to protect its game plan. Overall, the deck aims to generate a large amount of mana and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and disruptive plays.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by leveraging the powerful land Gaea's Cradle to generate large amounts of mana and cast powerful creatures like Allosaurus Shepherd, Atraxa, Grand Unifier, and Craterhoof Behemoth. The deck also includes efficient mana acceleration with cards like Birds of Paradise and Ignoble Hierarch, as well as disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Wasteland. By controlling the board and ramping into big threats, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with various disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Skyclave Apparition while also providing aggressive threats like Stoneforge Mystic and Recruiter of the Guard. The deck utilizes Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and Karakas to protect important creatures like Yorion, Sky Nomad or Legendary creatures. The deck seeks to control the tempo of the game by using efficient removal like Swords to Plowshares and Thoughtseize while also establishing a powerful board presence with multiple threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures while disrupting opponent's strategies with cards like Karakas, Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, and Opposition Agent. Stoneforge Mystic and Aether Vial provide additional versatility and card advantage. It also includes a strong removal suite with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Skyclave Apparition. The deck aims to beat down opponents quickly while controlling the board through various disruptive effects, making it difficult for opponents to execute their game plan effectively.

The main idea behind this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan while also maintaining card advantage and controlling the board. With a mix of powerful spells like Brainstorm, Force of Will, and Kolaghan's Command, along with efficient creatures like Baleful Strix and Snapcaster Mage, the deck aims to control the game through card advantage and removal spells. The inclusion of cards like Cling to Dust, Thoughtseize, and Reanimate also provide additional disruption and graveyard interaction, making it a versatile and adaptable control deck in the Legacy format.

The deck revolves around assembling a powerful combo involving Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies to generate infinite mana, which can then be used to win the game with Walking Ballista or other combo pieces. The deck also includes various support cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Enlightened Tutor to help find key pieces, as well as disruption cards like Swords to Plowshares and Static Prison to control the game. The mana base includes essential lands like Gaea's Cradle and Karakas to support the combo and ensure consistency in executing the game plan.

This deck focuses on aggressively controlling the board with a mix of creatures, spells, and disruptive elements. It aims to outmaneuver opponents by utilizing cards like Brainstorm and Guide of Souls to maintain card advantage and make efficient trades. The deck includes powerful removal options like Swords to Plowshares and Solitude, while also incorporating strong threats like Murktide Regent and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd. By leveraging a combination of tempo plays and resilient creatures, this deck aims to apply constant pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure victory.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing lands to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It aims to lock down the opponent by utilizing cards like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a powerful Merit Lage token, while also utilizing cards like Wasteland and Ghost Quarter to disrupt the opponent's mana base. Life from the Loam is used to recur key lands and keep the engine going, while cards like Boseiju, Who Endures and Malevolent Rumble provide additional disruption and protection. The deck aims to out-value and out-control the opponent through its land-based strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm your opponent with aggressive creatures and disruption spells. By utilizing cards like Abhorrent Oculus and Ice-Fang Coatl to apply early pressure and controlling the game with cards like Force of Will and Daze, this deck aims to establish board dominance and finish the game before the opponent can stabilize. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Birthing Ritual and Flare of Denial provides some additional utility and versatility to keep the opponent off balance. Overall, this deck is designed to be fast-paced and proactive in its strategy.

The main concept of the deck is to maintain control of the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures like Murktide Regent and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd. The deck aims to use Stoneforge Mystic to search for equipment like Batterskull to provide additional threats and value. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps to generate card advantage and provide further ways to control the game. The deck also includes versatile spells like Prismatic Ending and Thoughtseize to handle a variety of threats.

The main concept of this Legacy Stoneblade deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Stoneforge Mystic. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Will and Stifle while also generating card advantage and tempo with cards like Brainstorm and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. By efficiently managing resources and choosing the right moment to deploy threats, this deck seeks to outlast and outmaneuver opponents until securing a win condition through efficient beatdown or card advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly control the board and disrupt the opponent?s strategy while maintaining a fast-paced aggressive playstyle. By utilizing cards like Brainstorm, Daze, Fatal Push, and Thoughtseize, the deck can manipulate the game in its favor and maintain tempo. Additionally, the inclusion of creatures like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares provide additional threats to pressure the opponent. The deck aims to capitalize on the opponent's vulnerabilities and exploit them to secure victory in a Legacy 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on utilizing Death's Shadow as a powerful threat, using cards like Street Wraith and Thoughtseize to decrease your own life total. This enables you to quickly play Death's Shadow as a large creature while also disrupting your opponent with counter spells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck also includes Delver of Secrets and Murktide Regent for additional threats and control elements like Hymn to Tourach and Fatal Push to maintain momentum and disrupt your opponent's game plan. The mana base is focused on fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.
